| **Date** | **Sign** | |
|  | | | | | | | | |
| Documented Process control procedure | Are processes reviewed to identify manufacturing process control points that could affect product quality?  Did the hazard and risk management team identify and record all potential product defects that are reasonably expected to occur at each step in relation to the product and process?  Do the hazards considered shall include, where applicable:  ·         product quality defects  ·         defects that may have an impact on the functional integrity and performance of the final product in use  ·         defects which result in the production of products which are outside customer-specified quality parameters. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
|  | Are machine settings or process limits established for each manufacturing process control point? Are they documented and records kept?  Where equipment settings are critical to the safety or legality of the product, changes to the equipment settings was it completed by trained and authorised staff. Where applicable, controls shall be password-protected or otherwise restricted. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Are documented process checks undertaken at start-up, following adjustments to equipment and throughout the production run to ensure products conform to agreed quality specification? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Process Specification Control - Machinery running in accordance to tolerances laid out on Job Card. Any deviation is flagged and recorded on log sheet and NCA with concession given by Team Leader? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| All employees at work station and aware of potential to product contamination? No obvious signs of risk to product contamination on all machinery? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Can all materials used within a job be accounted for? Is there a ticket containing materials and specs on every job? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Is there a documented line clearance procedure to ensure that the line is clear of previous work and production documents? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Are changes to product composition, processing methods or equipment reviewed to re-establish process characteristics and validate product data? Is this review conducted to ensure product safety, legality and quality are maintained? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Procedure easily accessible | Is this procedure easily available on the electronic and hard copy format? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Latest procedure live on system and hard copy available | Review the header - is it the latest revision, check that the dates and signatures are present on the hard copy Is it a controlled copy? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Up to date records table | Is the Records table up to date? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
| Record compliance | Select a key Records input and verify compliance.  Correct revision in use?  If records are changed after initial recording/entry, are changes clearly legible (errors marked  through and initialed); recorded in ink, not pencil? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | |
